TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 591
TEI.2.document_title: Ignacio Doninguez to J F Madero, 02-01-1831

barker_notes.barker_summary: Ignacio Dominguez to Jose Francisco Madero, February 1, 1831. Informs him that he has orders from Bradburn not to permit titles to be granted to settlers in the reserve. Madero replies that he does not recognize Bradburn's authority to alter the constitution by giving an ex post facto operation to the law of April 6, 3830. (Omitted.)
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 591

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Ignacio Dominguez to Jose Francisco Madero, February 1, 1831. Informs him that he has orders from Bradburn not to permit titles to be granted to settlers in the reserve. Madero replies that he does not recognize Bradburn's authority to alter the constitution by giving an ex post facto operation to the law of April 6, 3830. (Omitted.)*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Atascosito*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="02-01-1831">February 1, 1831*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*See Calendar*/p*
*/div1*
